text:
Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm AnnÂ 
Reardon and this is an episode ofÂ Â

Cake Rescue where we take viral cake fails fromÂ 
Youtube, TikTok and across the internet and showÂ Â

you how to rescue them. Let's start with cakeÂ 
number one ... the frog cake ğŸ¸ This popular frogÂ Â

cake design and many similar ones came from OracleÂ 
bakery in California. Mariola's sister loves frogsÂ Â

so they are attempting to recreate the frog cakeÂ 
for her birthday and you can see here MariolaÂ Â

is pouring buttercream on top of the cake thatÂ 
they made. Buttercream should not be thin likeÂ Â

custard this is a red flag already something isÂ 
very wrong. Now they did manage to spread this outÂ Â

as best as they could and even pipe some detailsÂ 
around the edge that they said were drooping downÂ Â

and their initial piping of the frog looks greatÂ 
but once they left it for a couple of minutes itÂ Â

totally collapsed and in their own words: weÂ 
epicly failed. I'm going to start this rescueÂ Â

with the buttercream i've got heaps of buttercreamÂ 
recipes for all different flavors on my websiteÂ Â

and i'm just using the basic buttercream recipeÂ 
today now in this case they wanted a dairy-freeÂ Â

buttercream so i'm going to use dairy-freeÂ 
margarine which if you look at the ingredientsÂ Â

is just like normal margarine it's made fromÂ 
vegetable oil the only thing that's missing isÂ Â

the milk solids which there wasn't heaps of anywayÂ 
so it's going to be very similar in behaviour toÂ Â

normal margarine in frosting. Now to start with inÂ 
this recipe i like to have no liquid at all and atÂ Â

this point it looks so thick that most peopleÂ 
pour in liquid but I want you just to go withÂ Â

just the margarine and icing sugar, turn up theÂ 
speed and wait. One minute later and you get thisÂ Â

look how beautiful and thick that frosting isÂ 
you could pipe it or put it on the side of a cakeÂ Â

and it's not going to flop it's not goingÂ 
anywhere it will hold its shape. Now let meÂ Â

show you what will happen if i add to that threeÂ 
tablespoons of liquid. Keep in mind this is aÂ Â

big triple batch of buttercream so that's justÂ 
like adding one tablespoon to a single batch.Â Â

After it's been whipped in it's still firm butÂ 
it's not as good vertically as before it's aÂ Â

little bit softer. Now let's add another threeÂ 
tablespoons of milk or milk alternative whateverÂ Â

you're using and whip that up and you can see it'sÂ 
still okay but it's definitely softer it's a bitÂ Â

like a whipped cream consistency it's not goingÂ 
to hold on the side of a cake. Now at this pointÂ Â

a lot of people think they can just thicken it upÂ 
by adding more icing sugar to it but in realityÂ Â

you'd have to add the whole quantity of icingÂ 
sugar you had for the recipe to thicken this up.Â Â

Let me show you after adding a whole extra cupÂ 
of icing sugar it's still a droopy frosting.Â Â

Now i've added a little more milk into this nowÂ 
and some yellow colouring to get the custardyÂ Â

consistency that they had in their video.Â 
If you're trying to make frosting and itÂ Â

looks like this i'd say just mix in some eggsÂ 
baking powder and flour and turn it into a cakeÂ Â

...make a new batch of frosting in other words.Â 
Pipe on the frog and we have recreated the failÂ Â

to fix this i would treat the initial thing asÂ 
a really thin crumb coat we are going to have toÂ Â

take off any excess sloppy icing that's on theÂ 
cake or it's going to make everything fall off.Â Â

If you were happy with the yellowÂ 
you could leave it as it isÂ Â

but i've got a whole fresh batch of icingÂ 
here so i might as well put some on the cake.Â Â

Now that we're using buttercream thatÂ 
has no liquid in it you can see it isÂ Â

thick it stays where i put it you don't need aÂ 
turntable to do this you can just use a plateÂ Â

and spin it on your countertop and just useÂ 
a knife with a flat edge to straighten it.Â Â

Now onto the decorations don't pipe themÂ 
directly onto the cake put some bakingÂ Â

paper on a tray and we're just going to start withÂ 
some little mushroom stems just pipe and pull upÂ Â

then take a small amount ofÂ 
icing and colour it bright redÂ Â

and put the piping bag on top right in the middleÂ 
pressing down slightly and then squeeze to makeÂ Â

the top of your mushroom ğŸ„. Now pipe more of theseÂ 
than you need and then if you make some that flopÂ Â

over or that you don't like it doesn't matterÂ 
you don't have to use those you can choose yourÂ Â

favourite ones because they're not actually onÂ 
the cake yet. If yours are pointy on top likeÂ Â

mine are just wet your finger and pat it downÂ 
a little bit. Pipe some tiny dots of white allÂ Â

around the top of your mushroom and when you'reÂ 
done just put that whole tray in the freezer.Â Â

Grab another tray line it with baking paper andÂ 
pipe a mound of green icing for your frog's body,Â Â

now use some acetate or you could use some thinÂ 
cardboard and drag it up the sides to smooth itÂ Â

out. I really do think Mariola could have pulledÂ 
this off if she had the right icing and then justÂ Â

use a wet finger and flatten down the top how youÂ 
decorate the frog is up to you ... i'm adding fiveÂ Â

little white dots for a flower then you need twoÂ 
green dots on top of the head for the eyes thisÂ Â

piping tip is a little bit small for this jobÂ 
and then pipe on some arms. Definitely if youÂ Â

had a slightly larger tip it would look better useÂ 
that ğŸ˜ƒ you will notice that i have more than oneÂ Â

of these frogs and that again is so i can chooseÂ 
the one that i like the best at the end why notÂ Â

but if you are a bakery you can see it wouldÂ 
make sense for them to make trays and traysÂ Â

of these at once and then they can just putÂ 
them on the cakes when someone orders a cake.Â Â

Once you've piped on the details put the wholeÂ 
tray in the freezer for at least an hour. Once theÂ Â

decorations are frozen you can pick them up andÂ 
position them where you want them on the cake nowÂ Â

if you hold these in your hands obviously they areÂ 
going to melt so be quick about it while you'reÂ Â

holding it. Use your leftover frog green icing toÂ 
pipe some little reeds around the top of the cakeÂ Â

and then with the leftover white pipe someÂ 
extra little flowers like the one the frogÂ Â

is holding. Choose your favourite frog andÂ 
put it near the edge of the cake on one sideÂ Â

and then just pipe on aÂ 
couple of little legs for himÂ Â

and you have yourself a rescued frog cake! NoÂ 
one would even know that it started with a fail.Â Â

Now for cake number two ... the boyfriend cake.Â 
Molly wants to make her boyfriend a thoughtfulÂ Â

handmade birthday gift so she's ordered a customÂ 
cake topper and is making him a cake. Now by herÂ Â

own admission she cannot bake so she is startingÂ 
with two store-bought cakes which is totally fineÂ Â

it's good to know your limitations. She doesÂ 
realise that this is not straight so she makesÂ Â

some adjustments and accidentally breaks aÂ 
chunk off the top of the cake and i'll letÂ Â

Molly take it from here: the next step is theÂ 
icing I have tons of this red play-doh lookingÂ Â

substance a little bit of flour i'm just goingÂ 
to warm it up in my hands a bit first is that nowÂ Â

it's covered in the flour marks but i think it'llÂ 
be fine because i'm going to decorate it anyway soÂ Â

let's see what i can do. Whoa hold the phoneÂ 
i just like putting a little putting a littleÂ Â

outfit on it i'm getting the cake dressed. UmÂ 
hi Tom happy 21st i know we were meant to haveÂ Â

just got back from Barli but here's a really goodÂ 
substitute present that's the worst thing you'veÂ Â

ever seen in your life please don't sign me up forÂ 
Bake Off. It really is not what i saw on pinterestÂ Â

it's really really not no matter which way i turnÂ 
this it doesn't improve like got this rigidityÂ Â

oh it's just not good is it like? I'm not doneÂ 
yet what's the matter with it it? Looks like aÂ Â

flat tyre! I don't know how to make it better iÂ 
don't think i can't make it better. Okay let'sÂ Â

recreate the fail using two store-bought icedÂ 
chocolate cakes and a dash of store-bought icingÂ Â

to make sure the lumps and bumps under there areÂ 
the ones that you want to be showing the world.Â Â

Second mistake was the flower don't roll yourÂ 
fondant out with flour it will stick to it and dryÂ Â

out the fondant. The third problem was piping onÂ 
store-bought frosting it is really soft it's notÂ Â

ideal for piping because it's just going to droopÂ 
down which is exactly what happened on her cake.Â Â

Now to rescue it ... well personally i wouldn'tÂ 
touch it because it was a gift from her to herÂ Â

boyfriend she's put in a lot of effort she's evenÂ 
ordered a custom cake topper with his name on itÂ Â

and i think it's special but if she wanted toÂ 
fix it and she had a spare half an hour thisÂ Â

is what i'd tell her to do. Take the topper offÂ 
and keep it safe, pull the flour covered fondantÂ Â

off she said she bought lots of this so let'sÂ 
just get rid of it the flour's going to make itÂ Â

taste weird and it doesn't look good so we'llÂ 
just get rid of that bit. The top cake is splitÂ Â

and cracked and broken so i'm going to removeÂ 
that one off the top. The bottom one is a wholeÂ Â

cake that's not broken at all so i'm going to useÂ 
that one for the top by using the broken one onÂ Â

the bottom it has the support of the baseboard andÂ 
it's less likely to fall apart but we do not wantÂ Â

it domed it needs to be flat before we add anotherÂ 
cake on top. Now here frosting was set a lotÂ Â

firmer than this one so for that you just use aÂ 
hot knife and then just cut through the frosting.Â Â

Frosting the hotter it is or the warmer it is theÂ 
softer it is so once you've taken it off the cakeÂ Â

you can actually microwave it for a few secondsÂ 
to make it softer and then use it on the cake.Â Â

Add the cake that's not broken on top and now useÂ 
the chocolate icing that was salvaged off the cakeÂ Â

to smooth out the sides. She also had thatÂ 
soft store-bought icing which is reallyÂ Â

not ideal for this function at all but i need aÂ 
little bit more frosting so i'll use some of thatÂ Â

just to help fill in all the gaps so that it'sÂ 
not going to have any lumps and bumps that weÂ Â

don't want, it won't have sharp corners at theÂ 
top like a perfectly covered cake but it willÂ Â

be fine. Ideally for this cake i would make aÂ 
batch of red buttercream and not use fondant atÂ Â

all but she is limited to store-bought items onlyÂ 
nothing homemade so i'm sticking to those rules.Â Â

Now grab the fondant and give it a squeeze if it'sÂ 
too hard you can microwave it but just do it forÂ Â

five seconds at a time you don't want to makeÂ 
it liquid. This one is okay consistency placeÂ Â

it onto some baking paper so it doesn't stick toÂ 
your counter and then spray it with some vegetableÂ Â

oil this is just canola cooking oil. Using oilÂ 
helps stop it stick to the rolling pin and itÂ Â

also helps stop the fondant from drying out whileÂ 
you're working with it. Then you want to roll thatÂ Â

out into one big circle use the baking paper toÂ 
help you pick that up and flip it over onto theÂ Â

cake. Now i know it looks like this doesn't fitÂ 
but from here you just have to lift and lowerÂ Â

lift and lower. Press it onto the cake around theÂ 
top where there are no folds and then just keepÂ Â

lifting and lowering around the base and gentlyÂ 
pressing it onto the cake. Once it gets down toÂ Â

the lower area cut off some of that excess andÂ 
continue lifting and lowering until it's smoothÂ Â

on the cake. Use a knife to trim that excessÂ 
fondant from around the base and now instead ofÂ Â

piping on that soft frosting i'm going to useÂ 
some compound white chocolate. Just microwaveÂ Â

that for 30 seconds stir and repeat until it'sÂ 
melted then put it into a ziplock bag and cut offÂ Â

a tiny corner starting on the top of the cake nearÂ 
the edge but not right on the edge pipe a line ofÂ Â

chocolate and then pipe it a little bit more justÂ 
in sections letting it slowly go towards the edge,Â Â

now you can always go back and add more ifÂ 
you need it and so that you can have theÂ Â

drips wherever you want them on the cake.Â 
Add the happy birthday back in the centreÂ Â

and cover the top with strawberries and chocolatesÂ 
just like it was on the pinterest one she saw.

Now for cake number four chocolate glaze ... i'mÂ 
not actually sure what happened to cake numberÂ Â

three apparently i've forgotten how to count butÂ 
now that i've animated the title with number fourÂ Â

we're just gonna go with it ğŸ˜‚ ... Andrea is havingÂ 
a lot of trouble with this glaze when you glaze aÂ Â

dessert the dessert needs to be frozen so thatÂ 
the glaze sets quickly when you pour it overÂ Â

and you also can't have the glaze too hot or itÂ 
will melt a layer of the dessert and just slideÂ Â

off. Which is initially what i thought was goingÂ 
on here that was until i realised she's trying toÂ Â

glaze an ice cream cake ... now ice cream as youÂ 
know melts at room temperature so even a slightlyÂ Â

warm glaze is going to melt a layer of ice creamÂ 
and it will slide off. If you want to glaze anÂ Â

ice cream cake you're going to need to cover theÂ 
cake in a layer of something that isn't totallyÂ Â

liquid at room temperature. A ganache madeÂ 
from cream and chocolate is perfect for this.Â Â

Freshly made ganache is warm and too runny for ourÂ 
purposes so what you want to do is pour it into aÂ Â

ziplock bag then seal up the top and flatten itÂ 
out and just put it in the freezer for about 30Â Â

minutes after which time it won't be frozen but itÂ 
will have cooled enough that it's thick enough toÂ Â

spread it up the sides of a silicone baking mold.Â 
Keep going keep spreading it out until the wholeÂ Â

thing is covered in a thin layer of ganache. GetÂ 
the ice cream out of the freezer so it can softenÂ Â

and turn the freezer down as cold as it will go.Â 
Choose some chocolate bars that you want to goÂ Â

inside your ice cream cake and chop those up, nowÂ 
scoop the soft ice cream into the ganache linedÂ Â

mold. Squash it down and then add the chocolatesÂ 
on top. Now add a layer of different ice creamÂ Â

and you just want to level that off at the topÂ 
and put it in the freezer overnight so it can setÂ Â

really firm. For the glaze put some cream intoÂ 
a bowl and this recipe is on my website for you,Â Â

then just add the sugar and the water. MicrowaveÂ 
that until the sugar is dissolved then add theÂ Â

cocoa powder the glucose syrup and the bloomedÂ 
gelatin and stir it really well. Finally we wantÂ Â

to pour that through a sieve to make sure it'sÂ 
free of any lumps and then we're just going toÂ Â

cover that and leave it at room temperature.Â 
The next day when we're ready to use it itÂ Â

looks like this ... it's set. Now we want to warmÂ 
it up slightly to make it liquid but it shouldn'tÂ Â

feel hot so it should be about the temperatureÂ 
of your hand so it shouldn't feel hot or coldÂ Â

on your hand. If you in the process of meltingÂ 
it in the microwave made it too hot you're goingÂ Â

to have to leave it to cool down. Once you'reÂ 
ready ladle it over the frozen ganache coveredÂ Â

ice cream cake you're going to want to make sureÂ 
you add enough of that glaze for it to coverÂ Â

all the sides you don't want any gaps justÂ 
keep scooping it on and then you just haveÂ Â

to wait about a minute for that dripping toÂ 
slow down as the gelatin in the glaze setsÂ Â

and once the drips just stop you can scrape itÂ 
off around the bottom and transfer it onto a coldÂ Â

plate and then you just put that back in theÂ 
freezer because it's an ice cream dessertÂ Â

and make your freezer not so cold so thatÂ 
you can cut it when it's time to serve it.Â Â

Cake number five is the sweet shop cake ... nowÂ 
this cake started out so well it was a jointÂ Â

effort between Caitlyn and her daughter for herÂ 
daughter's birthday, the cake itself was bakedÂ Â

beautifully the frosting looked good doing soÂ 
well, decorating with lollies was fantastic andÂ Â

the finished cake looks great and then: it smashedÂ 
didn't it. Just collapsed while we were waitingÂ Â

for people to arrive. Last minute cake fails don'tÂ 
give you much time to work i mean the guests areÂ Â

already there let's recreate the fail and see whatÂ 
we can do. I'm baking my almond and blueberry cakeÂ Â

for the base and i'm using a packet cake for theÂ 
back because it'll be a little bit firmer thanÂ Â

a nice soft moist cake would be. Decorate theÂ 
cake with frosting and lollies ğŸ¬ all around itÂ Â

and now i need to add the back into place.Â 
As a general rule if you ever go more thanÂ Â

two layers of cake high you need to addÂ 
support. If you want to know how to doÂ Â

that watch my Spongebob cake tutorial that's aÂ 
tall slim cake and you'll know how to do that.Â Â

I don't want to wait for mine to collapseÂ 
it will collapse because it's only cake itÂ Â

won't stand up on its side for long but i'm justÂ 
going to give it a shake to speed up the process.Â Â

Now if i had just arrived at this party i wouldÂ 
love to have rescued this for them. The mum in theÂ Â

original video has five kids and is currentlyÂ 
going through cancer treatment and i'm amazedÂ Â

that she had energy to make a birthday cake atÂ 
all. Well done please do go check out her vlogsÂ Â

and send us some encouragement and your prayersÂ 
what a champion i'll link to her channel below.Â Â

Now that this has fallen once it is goingÂ 
to be even more unstable than it was beforeÂ Â

so to sort of quickly rescue it i'm going toÂ 
push two plastic straws down into the cake.Â Â

Ideally it needs a lot more support than this butÂ 
the guests are already there so it really justÂ Â

needs a quick fix to make it last just for a fewÂ 
minutes while you're singing happy birthday. ForÂ Â

any damaged areas i'm going to get some icing justÂ 
from the back of the cake where no one can seeÂ Â

and use it to fix the front of the cake. UseÂ 
a knife just to neaten it up and take off anyÂ Â

frosting that's in the wrong places and for thisÂ 
little cake decoration we're just going to getÂ Â

rid of the top of it that's covered in frostingÂ 
and put it back where it was and if there's aÂ Â

spare lolly just pop that on top if you'veÂ 
got one. Even though it's standing the backÂ Â

still looks a bit sad so i've printed out a signÂ 
and stuck it on some cardboard so that the oilÂ Â

from the buttercream doesn't just soak into itÂ 
as quickly and then just to push that into place.Â Â

When a cake collapses at the last minute thereÂ 
really is not a lot you can do to rescue it butÂ Â

do keep smiling it is just cake at the end of theÂ 
day it's still going to taste good and it reallyÂ Â

doesn't matter. With thanks to my amazing patronsÂ 
for your support i really appreciate it if youÂ Â

enjoyed this video let the algorithm know that youÂ 
did by liking commenting subscribing and watchingÂ Â
